content:
On Confluence here

For the profoundly lazy :-) I'll try THIS ONE TIME attaching the meaty part at a stripped-down PDF. I won't bother again if nobody says HEY COOL DO THIS MORE.:-) 2020-07-16-Patient-Empowerment-Draft-Agenda.pdf

:stuck_out_tongue: frickin' kiwis .... :-)

Now let's see whether anyone else cares or if I can just bcc you on all my stuff!
I am Canadian, David Hay is the Kiwi
No WONDER you're so polite! Thanks for re-orienting me.

Dave deBronkart

On Confluence here

For the profoundly lazy :-) I'll try THIS ONE TIME attaching the meaty part at a stripped-down PDF. I won't bother again if nobody says HEY COOL DO THIS MORE.:-) [2020-07-16-Patient-Empowerment-Draft-Agenda.pdf

Dave, on behalf of all of the profoundly lazy, thank you for posting this up "one time", and a hearty request for it to be done again!

No WONDER you're so polite! Thanks for re-orienting me.

hey! I object! Kiwi's are polite too... (even politer than Canadians)
I'm sorry, we didn't mean to make you feel insecure

David Pyke said:

I'm sorry, we didn't mean to make you feel insecure

OMG you guys - it's bad enough that we have Karens and Kens, the obnoxious cliches - are you gonna necessitate us creating Davids, who are the opposite - unnecessarily polite?? :-)

You won't get many smartphone videos of such behaviour, I'll warn you...

'Davids' - I like that. A new internet meme is born.

You heard it here first, folks...

Dave deBronkart said:
I'm not a native English speaker, but what does 

 unnecessarily polite

mean?...
It means an American would never consider doing it.
